But where exactly is this epidemic going?</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Fri, 21 Nov 2014 16:40:04 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10399697.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid U.S. firm in talks on Canadian Ebola vaccine production</title><description>The small American company licensed by Canada to produce an Ebola vaccine is in talks with pharmaceutical giant Merck & Co., which could lead to faster production and distribution of a product that scientists hope will snuff out the outbreak.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Fri, 21 Nov 2014 13:40:10 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10399826.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid may cause angst for many teens, but treatable</title><description>For teens especially, having complexion-marring acne can erode self-confidence during a life stage when fitting in with peers is often of utmost importance.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 20 Nov 2014 17:00:07 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10398532.jpg" type="image/jpeg" scenario Ebola estimate will not happen: CDC</title><description>A U.S. health official says the government's worst-case scenario forecast for the Ebola epidemic in West Africa won't happen.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 19 Nov 2014 20:40:06 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10391501.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid day at a time</title><description>After a serious bike accident, 53-year-old had to relearn how to live: I didn&#8217;t question the road ahead, I just knew I had to fight to get there</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 19 Nov 2014 23:49:13 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10386056.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link Foundation, other donors launch study of Ebola drugs, survivors' blood, in Africa</title><description>A group of donors led by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation will provide experimental drugs and fund a study to collect blood plasma from Ebola survivors to treat new victims of the disease in West Africa.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 19 Nov 2014 18:45:06 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10239789.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid couple hit with $950K bill after premature birth in U.S.</title><description>A Humboldt couple faces possible bankruptcy after Blue Cross refused to pay a $950,000 medical bill incurred when their daughter was born ahead of schedule while they were on vacation in Hawaii.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 19 Nov 2014 23:03:13 Z</pubDate><enclosure Medical Association president disappointed province didn't ban menthol</title><description>EDMONTON - The president of the Alberta Medical Association says he is disappointed the province did not include menthol in its flavoured tobacco ban law.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Tue, 18 Nov 2014 22:10:05 Z</pubDate><enclosure Clinic does its second face transplant</title><description>Cleveland Clinic surgeons have replaced nearly the entire face of a middle-aged man severely disfigured in a car accident, the hospital announced Tuesday.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Tue, 18 Nov 2014 18:40:07 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10391816.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10391726</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Heart+infections+rose+after+preventive+dental+antibiotics+fell/10391726/story.html</link><title>Heart infections rose after use of preventive dental antibiotics fell, British study finds</title><description>Curbing the routine use of preventive antibiotics before dental work may have contributed to a rise in heart valve infections in England, a new study suggests. In the U.S., the highest risk patients still get these drugs and no similar trend has been seen.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Tue, 18 Nov 2014 20:10:02 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10392003.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10391513</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/family-child/Kids+with+allergies+more+likely+bullied+research/10391513/story.html</link><title>Kids with allergies more likely to be bullied, research shows</title><description>Tessa Bantock was labelled &#8220;allergy girl&#8221; and even pelted with nuts by her classmates at school. Growing up with a food allergy can be tough, but when children with serious allergies are bullied, the consequences are potentially life-threatening.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Tue, 18 Nov 2014 16:21:37 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/5830408.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10349349</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Patient+doctor+life+care+talks+happen+infrequently+Canada+Study/10349349/story.html</link><title>Patient-doctor end-of-life care talks happen infrequently in Canada: Study</title><description>Canadian doctors are not sparing the time to talk to seriously ill patients about their wishes around death and dying, including whether they would want to be kept alive &#8220;at all costs&#8221; if their heart or breathing stopped, new research [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Tue, 04 Nov 2014 15:43:53 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/8749692.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10355559</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/seniors/Doctors+check+brain+signs+dementia/10355559/story.html</link><title>Doctors to check "brain age" for signs of dementia</title><description>Middle-aged people in England will be screened by family doctors for their risk of dementia and told how their "brain age" compares to their biological age, under new plans to "scare" people into adopting healthier lifestyles.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 05 Nov 2014 19:53:18 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10322043.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10382624</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Living+kidney+donors+face+higher+health+risks+during+later/10382624/story.html</link><title>Living kidney donors face higher health risks during later pregnancies: Study</title><description>TORONTO - A new study says that women who have donated a kidney are at higher risk of developing gestational hypertension or a potentially dangerous condition called pre-eclampsia during pregnancies that follow the donation.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Mon, 17 Nov 2014 17:10:05 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/9841994.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10265109</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Worst+place+have+stroke+hospital+researchers/10265109/story.html</link><title>Worst place to have stroke is in a hospital, researchers say</title><description>A hospital can be the worst place to have a stroke, the first study of its kind in Canada has found. Researchers who looked at more than 33,000 stroke patients in Ontario found those who suffered a stroke while hospitalized [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Tue, 04 Nov 2014 16:21:42 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/9310704.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10252572</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Canada+prepping+potential+Ebola+cases+still+sees+risk+Ambrose/10252572/story.html</link><title>Canada prepping for potential Ebola cases but still sees risk as low: Ambrose</title><description>TORONTO - Canada is considering placing doses of an experimental Ebola vaccine in hospitals around the country that have been designated to treat Ebola cases if any arrive in the country, the new chief public health officer said Wednesday.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 02 Oct 2014 15:50:03 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10253025.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10253332</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Free+birth+control+cuts+teen+pregnancy+abortions+study+shows/10253332/story.html</link><title>Free birth control cuts teen pregnancy, abortions</title><description>Giving teens free birth control encourages them to use long-acting methods and greatly cuts the chances they will become pregnant or have an abortion, a new study finds.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 02 Oct 2014 15:50:04 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10253351.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10252038</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/reports+enterovirus+cases+child+teen+with+poliolike+symptoms/10252038/story.html</link><title>B.C. reports two enterovirus cases in child and teen with polio-like symptoms</title><description>TORONTO - Health officials in British Columbia say they have seen two young people infected with enterovirus D68 who also suffered from polio-like symptoms.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 01 Oct 2014 22:30:06 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10207298.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10234672</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/news/national/Canada+contribute+another+million+Ebola+battle/10234672/story.html</link><title>Canada to contribute another $30 million to Ebola battle</title><description>NEW YORK &#8212; Canada will give another $30 million to the fight against the Ebola virus, which is ravaging West African countries and threatens to spread globally. In announcing the new funds Thursday at the United Nations, International Development Minister [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 25 Sep 2014 17:49:02 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10143731.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10234571</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Broken+hearted+Just+take+aspirin/10234571/story.html</link><title>Broken-hearted? Just take an aspirin or two</title><description>It was once thought that only time could mend a broken heart, but now scientists think taking a couple of aspirin might be the best way to get over a break-up.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 25 Sep 2014 17:38:38 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10234572.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10231397</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/family-child/Brain+wave+test+could+diagnose+autistic+kids+more/10231397/story.html</link><title>Brain wave test could diagnose autistic kids more accurately - and earlier</title><description>The brains of children and adolescents with severe autism react differently to certain audio-visual stimuli than children and adolescents without autism, according to a new study.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 24 Sep 2014 18:40:02 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10231412.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10231330</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/diet-fitness/Fitness+with+limits+fear/10231330/story.html</link><title>Fitness with no limits, no fear</title><description>Louise Green wants women (and men, too, for that matter) to believe they can live a &#8220;limitless life.&#8221; So much so, the outgoing mother of one is writing a book about it.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 24 Sep 2014 16:04:58 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10223483.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10231725</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Study+finds+immune+activity+after+surgery+offers+clues+fast+slow/10231725/story.html</link><title>Study finds immune activity after surgery offers clues to how fast or slow patients recover</title><description>WASHINGTON - One of the big frustrations of surgery: There's little way to know if you'll be a fast or slow healer, someone who feels back to normal in a week or is out of work for a month with lingering pain and fatigue.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 24 Sep 2014 20:43:05 Z</pubDate></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10231130</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/family-child/What+tell+children+about+parent+cancer/10231130/story.html</link><title>What to tell children about a parent's cancer</title><description>"I can't imagine going through that with a child that age," we moms with cancer tell each other. Every parent, every kid, every cancer is so different. And we don't want to imagine it &#8212; how do you tell your 5-year-old? How do you know what your teenager is thinking?</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 24 Sep 2014 16:39:30 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10111490.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10228039</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Ebola+could+infect+million+West+Africa+February+Centre+Disease/10228039/story.html</link><title>Ebola could infect 1.4 million in West Africa by February: Centre for Disease Control</title><description>The number of Ebola cases in West Africa could reach 1.4 million by the end of January if trends continue without an immediate and massive scale-up in response, according to a new estimate by the Centers for Disease Control and [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Tue, 23 Sep 2014 21:04:14 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10228042.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10218170</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/diet-fitness/Wheat+Belly+author+William+Davis+declares+grains/10218170/story.html</link><title>Wheat Belly author William Davis declares war on all grains</title><description>Three years after the release of his massively popular book implicating wheat in an astonishing array of human ills, cardiologist William Davis is now urging people to dodge all grains, wheat and otherwise. In his new book, Wheat Belly Total [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Tue, 23 Sep 2014 01:34:01 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10218171.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10211520</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/diet-fitness/Sitting+long+treadmill+desk+left+cold/10211520/story.html</link><title>Sitting too long is bad for you, but a treadmill desk left me cold</title><description>I've now had the desk treadmill for more than a year, and I sometimes go weeks without turning it on.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 17 Sep 2014 21:41:12 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10211523.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10211353</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/business/Drugstores+retailers+dive+deeper+into+shots+other+vaccines/10211353/story.html</link><title>Drugstores, retailers dive deeper into flu shots, other vaccines</title><description>Walgreen provided enough flu shots last season to protect a population roughly twice the size of Los Angeles.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 17 Sep 2014 19:38:28 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10211354.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10205568</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Light+exposure+adjusting+local+time+among+ways+help+stave/10205568/story.html</link><title>Light exposure, adjusting to local time among ways to help stave off jet lag</title><description>TORONTO - After succumbing to afternoon sleepiness during a visit to Paris, Colleen Friesen was determined not to let jet lag extinguish her energy on a return trip to the City of Light.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Mon, 15 Sep 2014 21:37:15 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10205569.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10183351</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Thyroid+kidney+cancers+rise+slightly+kids+overall+childhood/10183351/story.html</link><title>Thyroid, kidney cancers rise slightly in kids; overall childhood cancer rate is stable: Study</title><description>Children's kidney and thyroid cancers have increased in recent years, and though the diseases are rare, experts wonder if the rising rates could be related to obesity.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Mon, 08 Sep 2014 14:30:05 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10184497.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10174386</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/More+more+Americans+forbid+smoking+home+even+smoker+lives+there/10174386/story.html</link><title>More and more Americans forbid smoking at home  -  even if a smoker lives there, CDC study says</title><description>NEW YORK, N.Y. - Smoking is banned in more than eight out of 10 U.S. homes &#8212; nearly twice as many as two decades ago, according to a new government study.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 04 Sep 2014 19:37:01 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10174433.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10171995</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/Yoga+Break+grounded+September/10171995/story.html</link><title>Yoga Break - Get grounded for September</title><description>Yoga instructor Johanna Steinfeld helps you get back into your fall routine with September's Yoga Break.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 03 Sep 2014 22:45:50 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10171998.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10168102</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/diet-fitness/Calling+shots+healthy+life/10168102/story.html</link><title>Calling the shots on a healthy life</title><description>For a very long time, Stephanie Presta was very unhappy, especially with her body. &#8220;When I look back at photos, I could see how unhappy I was, but wasn&#8217;t sure how to change things&#8221; the outgoing and friendly sales rep told me.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Tue, 02 Sep 2014 18:42:28 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10145011.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10169190</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Sportsrelated+concussion+youth+public+health+issue+that+demands/10169190/story.html</link><title>Sports-related concussion in youth a public health issue that demands action:paper</title><description>Sports-related concussions in children and youth constitute a significant public health issue which requires serious reform in public policy to address the harm associated with them, a new Canadian paper argues.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 03 Sep 2014 13:50:05 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10170488.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10168410</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/entertainment/Canadian+researchers+track+Angelina+effect+cancer+gene/10168410/story.html</link><title>Canadian researchers track 'Angelina effect' on cancer gene screening</title><description>It's being called "the Angelina effect."</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 03 Sep 2014 00:38:58 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10168443.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10165675</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/Actionpacked+might+also+pack+pounds+triggering+mindless+snacking/10165675/story.html</link><title>Action-packed TV might also pack on pounds by triggering mindless snacking, research suggests</title><description>Could action-packed TV fare make you fat? That's the implication of a new study that found people snacked more watching fast-paced television than viewing a more leisurely paced talk show.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Tue, 02 Sep 2014 14:30:08 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10167480.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10160352</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/news/edmonton/scientist+puts+finger+cancer+cell+tentacles+study+looks/10160352/story.html</link><title>U of A scientist puts a finger on cancer cell ‘tentacles’; New study looks at how cancer spreads through the body</title><description>A new study has pinpointed how cancer cells spread from one part of the body to another by forming &#8220;tentacles&#8221; that enable the cells to enter other organs, a finding that could open up new treatment possibilities in some cancers. A University of Alberta-based team was part of the research group that looked at the path cancer cells travel in the human body. Tumour cells enter the blood stream, then &#8220;exit&#8221; to another organ or area of the body. This is how cancer cells &#8220;metastasize&#8221; or spread in the body.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Mon, 01 Sep 2014 15:46:41 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10165404.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10156552</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/seniors/Tripping+treadmills+Scientists+make+seniors+slip+stop/10156552/story.html</link><title>Scientists make seniors slip in lab to see if it can stop future falls</title><description>Researchers are tripping seniors on purpose, and it&#8217;s not some kind of warped practical joke. The experiment is among techniques being studied to prevent falls, the leading cause of injury in older [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 28 Aug 2014 16:50:59 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10156554.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10150872</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/health/blood+pressure+care+surpass+officebased+treatment+some+patients/10150872/story.html</link><title>DIY blood pressure care may surpass office-based treatment for some patients: study</title><description>"Do-it-yourself" blood pressure measurements and medicine changes work better than usual doctor-office care in some patients, a study of older adults in England found.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 27 Aug 2014 17:00:07 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10150895.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.calgaryherald.com:content=10151418</guid><link>http://www.calgaryherald.com/news/montreal/Bariatric+procedure+toddler+raises+issues/10151418/story.html</link><title>Bariatric procedure on toddler raises issues</title><description>He was 2&#189; years old and morbidly obese. His parents sought help because he developed bowed legs from the excess weight and suffered sleep apnea that caused him to stop breathing.</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Wed, 27 Aug 2014 10:28:35 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.calgaryherald.com/cms/binary/10151461.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item></channel></rss>
